Prepare forward covariate step

Source: R/sim_reestExtra.R
covariate_step_tibble.Rd

Prepare forward covariate step

covariate_step_tibble(
  base,
  run_id,
  run_in = nm_default_dir("models"),
  dtest,
  direction = c("forward", "backward"),
  ...
)

Arguments

base

nm object
run_id

base run_id to construct run_ids of covariate runs
run_in

character. See run_in
dtest

tibble::tibble with testing relations (from test_relations)
direction

character. "forward" (default) or "backward"
...

additional arguments passed to add_cov

Value

tibble::tibble dtest with appended columns

See also

test_relations, covariate_step_tibble, bind_covariate_results

Examples

covariate_step_tibble,Prepare forward covariate step,Prepare forward covariate step — covariate_step_tibble,Source: R/sim_reestExtra.R,covariate_step_tibble.Rd,character(0),covariate_step_tibble,character(0),list(title = "Description", contents = "
Prepare forward covariate step
"),list(description = "Prepare forward covariate step"),covariate_step_tibble(
  base,
  run_id,
  run_in = nm_default_dir("models"),
  dtest,
  direction = c("forward", "backward"),
  ...
),list(list(name = "base", description = "
nm object
"), list(name = "run_id", description = "
base run_id to construct run_ids of covariate runs
"), list(name = "run_in", description = "
character.  See run_in
"), list(name = "dtest", description = "
tibble::tibble with testing relations (from test_relations)
"), list(name = "direction", description = "
character. \"forward\" (default) or \"backward\"
"), 
    list(name = "...", description = "
additional arguments passed to add_cov
")),TRUE,
if (FALSE) {

dtest <- test_relations(param = c("KA", "K", "V"),
                        cov = c("LIN1", "LIN2", "LIN3", "RND1", "RND2", "RND3"), 
                        state = c("linear", "power"), 
                        continuous = TRUE)
dtest <- dtest %>% 
             test_relations(param = c("KA", "K", "V"),
                            cov = "BN1",
                            state = "linear",
                            continuous = FALSE)
                            
## create tibble of covariate step with model objects as column m
dsm1 <- m1 %>% covariate_step_tibble(
  run_id = "m1_f1",
  dtest = dtest,
  direction = "forward"
)

## run all models greedily
dsm1$m <- dsm1$m %>% run_nm()

## extract results and put into tibble
dsm1 <- dsm1 %>% bind_covariate_results()

## sort by BIC (for example) and view
dsm1 <- dsm1 %>% arrange(BIC)
dsm1

## check condition number, covariance,... 
## run any diagnostics here

## when happy with selection, select run for subsequent step

m1_f1 <- dsm1$m[1]   ## select most signifcant BIC
# alternative select by relationship
m1_f1 <- dsm1 %>%
    filter(param = "CL", cov = "BWT", state = "power") %$%
    m

## do next forward step

dsm2 <- m1_f1 %>% covariate_step_tibble(
  run_id = "m1_f2",
  dtest = dtest,
  direction = "forward"
)

## continue ...
  
}
